009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Taubin's method [1]. Version 1 uses the full
024 * scatter and constraint matrix (6x6), the solution is found by a generalized
025 * symmetric eigendecomposition. Note that the constraint matrix (C) is not
026 * positive definite. 
027 * See [3, Sec. 11.2.1] for a detailed description (Alg. 11.7).
028 * This implementation performs data centering or,
029 * alternatively, accepts a specific reference point.
030 * <p>
031 * [1] G. Taubin, G. Taubin. "Estimation of planar curves, surfaces, and
032 * nonplanar space curves defined by implicit equations with applications to
033 * edge and range image segmentation", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and
034 * Machine Intelligence 13(11), 1115â€“1138 (1991).
035 * <br>
036 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
037 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2021/11/09
042 * @see EllipseFitTaubin2
043 */
044public class EllipseFitTaubin1 implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
045        
046        private final double[] q;       // = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
047        
048        public EllipseFitTaubin1(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
049                if (points.length < 5) {
050                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 5 points must be supplied for ellipse fitting");
051                }
052                this.q = fit(points, xref);
053                
054        }
055        
056        public EllipseFitTaubin1(Pnt2d[] points) {
057                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public double[] getParameters() {
062                return this.q;
063        }
064        
065        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
066        
067        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
068                final int n = points.length;
069                
070                // reference point
071                final double xr = xref.getX();
072                final double yr = xref.getY();
073
074                // design matrix (same as Fitzgibbon):
075                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
076                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
077                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
078                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
079                        double[] fi = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y), x, y, 1};
080                        X.setRow(i, fi);
081                }
082                
083                // scatter matrix S (normalized by 1/n)
084                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X).scalarMultiply(1.0/n);
085                        
086                double a = S.getEntry(0, 5);
087                double b = S.getEntry(2, 5);
088                double c = S.getEntry(1, 5);    //2*s[1][5];
089                double d = S.getEntry(3, 5);
090                double e = S.getEntry(4, 5);
091                
092                // constraint matrix
093                RealMatrix C = Matrix.makeRealMatrix(6, 6, 
094                                4*a, 2*c, 0,   2*d, 0,   0 , 
095                                2*c, a+b, 2*c, e,   d,   0 , 
096                                0,   2*c, 4*b, 0,   2*e, 0 , 
097                                2*d, e,   0,   1,   0,   0 ,
098                                0,   d,   2*e, 0,   1,   0 , 
099                                0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0 );
100                
101                // solve C*p = lambda*S*p (note: C is not positive definite!)
102                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition eigen = 
103                                new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(C, S, 1e-15, 1e-15); 
104                
105                double[] evals = eigen.getRealEigenvalues();
106                
107                int k = Matrix.idxMax(evals);   // index of largest eigenvalue
108                double[] qopt = eigen.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
109                
110                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
111                return U.operate(qopt);
112        }
113}
